1.title: Caples and Lasek Win Gold
1.plot: Curren Caples thwarted Pedro Barros& attempt to win his third straight X Games gold medal this year in Skateboard Park. The 17-year-old skater from California earned his first X Games gold, bumping Barros into second place with a buzzer-beating finish that came down to the final run.

3.title: BMX Park and RallyCross Kill It on Day 3
3.plot: The trio of Daniel Dhers, Scotty Cranmer and Daniel Sandoval went absolutely huge in the BMX Park final. While Liam Doran, Ken Block and the boys went crazy fast in the RallyCross finals at X Games Munich.

4.title: Burnquist Shines in Skateboard Big Air
4.plot: On the final day of competition at X Games Munich, Bob Burnquist made history, a new event dropped jaws and even the rain could not keep the fans away as a total of six gold medals got awarded closing out the action sports party in style.

5.title: Best of Munich
5.plot: The X Games action was plenty hot and the biggest stars did not disappoint in Munich, Germany. Liam Doran, Bob Burnquist Jeremy Stenberg and others put on the type of show that fans will remember for a long time.

1.title: Bob Burnquist's Brazil
1.plot: The opening night of X Games Foz was fast and furious. The fan favorite and Brazilian native Bob Burnquist captured gold in the Skateboard Big Air final. While Taddy Blazusiak and Laia Sanz put on a show in the Enduro X final.

2.title: Stenberg Three-Peats in Moto Best Whip
2.plot: Jeremy Stenberg won his third consecutive gold medal in Moto X Best Whip, as he took 36 percent of the Ford Fan Favorite vote on Twitter to narrowly edge Spanish rider Edgar Torrenteras.

4.title: Brazilian Blowout
4.plot: The stars came out to shine on the final day of competition at X Games Foz do IguaÃ§u. Travis Pastrana raced in the RallyCross finals. Brazilian teenager Pedro Barros won his third X Games Skateboard Park gold medal in four years. And Japanese freestyle motocross star Taka Higashino set the standard once again in the Moto X Freestyle final.

1.title: Kelly Clark Takes Gold on Day 1
1.plot: Kelly Clark captures her third consecutive X Games Tignes gold in the Women's Snowboard SuperPipe final.

2.title: Louie Vito, McRae Williams & Kaya Turski Take Gold on Day 2
2.plot: Putting their aerial antics on display, Louie Vito, Kaya Turski and McRae Willliams each captured gold medals to headline the second day of X Games Tignes action.

3.title: Toutant and Yater-Wallace Take Gold on Day 3
3.plot: An action packed day 2 of X Games Barcelona 2013 includes the finals of the BMX Vert, the Moto X Speed and Style and the Skateboard Big Air. With Bob Burnquist successfully defending his Skateboard Big Air title, that brings him to a total of 24 X Games medals, even with BMX legend Dave Mirra and ahead of snowboarder and skateboarder Shaun White for the medal-total record.

4.title: Best of Tignes
4.plot: High in the Alps, the weather at times was cold, wild and unpredictable. However, the X Games action was plenty hot and the biggest stars did not disappoint in Tignes, France.

3.title: Huston Wins Street
3.plot: X Games Barcelona 2013 continues with a fast paced day 3 of action. Nyjah Huston aims to keep up his string of success in Street League Skateboarding and in Women's Skateboard Park, the world meets Alana Smith, now the youngest medalist in X Games history.

4.title: Reynold's Six-Peat
4.plot: X Games Barcelona 2013 concludes in fitting fashion with the highest of heights in the Moto X Step Up and BMX Big Air. Garrett Reynolds goes for his sixth straight BMX Street title and Pedro Barros aims for a third consecutive Skateboard Park gold.

imdb.plot outline: The list of X Games host cities has boomed with Barcelona, Spain; Munich, Germany; Foz do Iguacu, Brazil; and Tignes, France chosen as venues through 2015. Latin America & Europe harbor some of the strongest action-sports cultures in the world... and we have all the top highlights you won't want to miss right here!
